intro: Bupleurum semidiaphanum f. flexicaule, commonly known as the flexible bupleurum, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its delicate structure and ornamental foliage make it a valued addition to botanical gardens and specialized horticultural collections.
